page.title: 08Westfield Development Centre
page.content: From August to September 1974,people in Fife and beyond became the world's first consumers of{SUBSTITUTE NATURAL} {GAS.}The importance of this to the American Gas Industry was enormous for, while American natural gas is running out, vast reserves of coal lie waiting to be tapped. In October 1974, 'The Lurgi' became officially known as{WESTFIELD DEVELOP- {MENT CENTRE}and has since then been used solely for experimental work. Its importance is illustrated by the fact that the British Gas Board spends Â£15m a year on this vital work which could help to ensure future energy supplies. Of a workforce of about 150, about two dozen come from Ballingry. Enquiries are under way to establish the cause of a recent explosion where one man died. Blair McQuade, Andrea Page and Gordon Stewart (12)
